alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Moore; Oldham; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 29 at 12:45PM CDT until March 30 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one-quarter and one mile in blowing dust expected. For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds up to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Deaf Smith, Moore, Oldham, and Sherman Counties. * WHEN...From Noon to 9 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects, and a few power outages may occur.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Persons with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep foot off the brake pedal. Remember, `Pull Aside, Stay Alive`.
